G

GameInterface - Interface in task2.model
This interface provides methods for controlling and displaying a game on the command line.


This interface provides methods for pressing virtual "buttons" on the game and retrieving the current game state.

This interface offers four directional buttons, and two action buttons.
They are internally called "up", "down", "left", "right", "a", and "b", but they can be labeled with any other names.
getALabel() - Method in interface task2.model.GameInterface
Returns the label of the a button.
getBLabel() - Method in interface task2.model.GameInterface
Returns the label of the b button.
getDownLabel() - Method in interface task2.model.GameInterface
Returns the label of the down button.
getGameState() - Method in interface task2.model.GameInterface
Returns a string that represents the current state of the game.
getLeftLabel() - Method in interface task2.model.GameInterface
Returns the label of the left button.
getRightLabel() - Method in interface task2.model.GameInterface
Returns the label of the right button.
getUpLabel() - Method in interface task2.model.GameInterface
Returns the label of the up button.

I

isRunning() - Method in interface task2.model.GameInterface
Returns true if the game is still running.

P

Indicates pressing a button.

Indicates pressing b button.

Indicates pressing down button.

Indicates pressing left button.

Indicates pressing right button.
